commit_message:
Implements volume backups via task flow

Change-Id: Ia6c86b319e49d38bcf5be5d1b09eec4e08612f08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/45376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (C) 2013 Yahoo! Inc. All Rights Reserved. # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack, LLC. # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import traceback from oslo.config import cfg from cinder.backup.flows import base from cinder import exception from cinder.image import glance from cinder.openstack.common import excutils from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging from cinder.openstack.common.notifier import api as notifier from cinder.openstack.common import processutils from cinder.openstack.common import timeutils from cinder import policy from cinder import quota from cinder.taskflow import decorators from cinder.taskflow.patterns import linear_flow from cinder.taskflow import task from cinder.volume import volume_types from cinder import units from cinder import utils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) ACTION = 'backup:create' CONF = cfg.CONF GB = units.GiB QUOTAS = quota.QUOTAS # Only in these 'sources' status can we attempt to create a backup from a # source volume or a source snapshot, other status states we can not create # from, 'error' being the common example. SNAPSHOT_PROCEED_STATUS = ('available',) SRC_VOL_PROCEED_STATUS = ('available', 'in-use',) # When a backup errors out we have the ability to save a piece of the exception # that caused said failure, but we don't want to save the whole message since # that could be very large, just save up to this number of characters. REASON_LENGTH = 128 def _make_pretty_name(method): """Makes a pretty name for a function/method.""" meth_pieces = [method.__name__] # If its an instance method attempt to tack on the class name if hasattr(method, 'im_self') and method.im_self is not None: try: meth_pieces.insert(0, method.im_self.__class__.__name__) except AttributeError: pass return ".".join(meth_pieces) def _find_result_spec(flow): """Find the last task that produced a valid backup_spec and returns it.""" for there_result in flow.results.values(): if not there_result or not 'backup_spec' in there_result: continue if there_result['backup_spec']: return there_result['backup_spec'] return None def _restore_volume_status(context, db, backup_spec): # NOTE(harlowja): Only if the type of the volume that was being created is # the source volume type should we try to reset the source volume status # back to its original value. if not backup_spec: return volume_id = backup_spec['volume_id'] volume_status = backup_spec['volume_status'] try: LOG.debug(_('Restoring source %(volume_id)s status to %(status)s') % {'status': volume_status, 'volume_id': volume_id}) db.volume_update(context, volume_id, {'status': volume_status}) except exception.CinderException: LOG.exception(_("Failed setting source volume %(volume_id)s back to" " its initial %(volume_status)s status") % {'volume_status': volume_status, 'volume_id': volume_id}) def _error_out_backup(context, db, backup_id, reason=None): def _clean_reason(reason): if reason is None: return '???' reason = str(reason) if len(reason) <= REASON_LENGTH: return reason else: return reason[0:REASON_LENGTH] + '...' update = { 'status': 'error', } reason = _clean_reason(reason) # TODO(harlowja): re-enable when we can support this in the database. # if reason: # status['details'] = reason try: LOG.debug(_('Updating backup: %(backup_id)s with %(update)s' ' due to: %(reason)s') % {'backup_id': backup_id, 'reason': reason, 'update': update}) db.volume_update(context, backup_id, update) except exception.CinderException: # Don't let this cause further exceptions. LOG.exception(_("Failed updating backup %(backup_id)s with" " %(update)s") % {'backup_id': backup_id, 'update': update}) class ExtractBackupRequestTask(base.CinderTask): """Processes an api request values into a validated set of values. This tasks responsibility is to take in a set of inputs that will form a potential backup request and validates those values against a set of conditions and/or translates those values into a valid set and then returns the validated/translated values for use by other tasks. Reversion strategy: N/A """ def __init__(self, service_check_functor=None): super(ExtractBackupRequestTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION]) # This task will produce the following outputs (said outputs can be # saved to durable storage in the future so that the flow can be # reconstructed elsewhere and continued). self.provides.update(['volume']) # This task requires the following inputs to operate (provided # automatically to __call__(). This is done so that the flow can # be reconstructed elsewhere and continue running (in the future). # # It also is used to be able to link tasks that produce items to tasks # that consume items (thus allowing the linking of the flow to be # mostly automatic). self.requires.update(['container', 'description', 'name', 'volume_id']) self.service_check_functor = service_check_functor if not self.service_check_functor: self.service_check_functor = lambda svc: True self.volume_api = cinder.volume.API() def _extract_volume(self, context, volume_id): volume = self.volume_api.get(context, volume_id) if volume['status'] != "available": msg = _('Volume to be backed up must be available') raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) return volume def __call__(self, context, container, name, volume_id): policy.enforce_action(context, ACTION) volume = self._extract_volume(context, volume_id) if not self.service_check_functor(volume): raise exception.ServiceNotFound(service_id='cinder-backup') return { 'volume': volume, } class EntryCreateTask(base.CinderTask): """Creates an entry for the given backup creation in the database. Reversion strategy: remove the backup_id created from the database. """ def __init__(self, db): super(EntryCreateTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION]) self.db = db self.requires.update(['description', 'name', 'volume']) self.provides.update(['backup_properties', 'backup_id', 'backup', 'revert_volume_status']) def __call__(self, context, **kwargs): """Creates a database entry for the given inputs and returns details. Accesses the database and creates a new entry for the to be created volume using the given volume properties which are extracted from the input kwargs (and associated requirements this task needs). These requirements should be previously satisifed and validated by a pre-cursor task. """ volume = kwargs.pop('volume') backup_properties = { 'user_id': context.user_id, 'project_id': context.project_id, 'display_name': kwargs.pop('name'), 'display_description': kwargs.pop('description'), 'volume_id': volume['id'], 'status': 'creating', 'container': container, 'size': volume['size'], # TODO(DuncanT): This will need de-managling once # multi-backend lands 'host': volume['host'], } # Merge in the other required arguments which should provide the rest # of the backup property fields (if applicable). revert_volume_status = volume['status'] self.db.volume_update(context, volume['id'], {'status': 'backing-up'}) backup_properties.update(kwargs) backup = self.db.backup_create(context, backup_properties) return { 'backup_id': backup['id'], 'backup_properties': backup_properties, # NOTE(harlowja): it appears like further usage of this volume # result actually depend on it being a sqlalchemy object and not # just a plain dictionary so thats why we are storing this here. # # In the future where this task results can be serialized and # restored automatically for continued running we will need to # resolve the serialization & recreation of this object since raw # sqlalchemy objects can't be serialized. 'backup': backup, 'revert_volume_status': revert_volume_status } def revert(self, context, result, cause): # We never produced a result and therefore can't destroy anything. if not result: return backup_id = result['backup_id'] try: self.db.backup_destroy(context, backup_id) except exception.CinderException: # We are already reverting, therefore we should silence this # exception since a second exception being active will be bad. LOG.exception(_("Failed destroying backup entry %s"), backup_id) revert_status = result['revert_volume_status'] try: self.db.volume_update(context, volume['id'], {'status': 'backing-up'}) class BackupCastTask(base.CinderTask): """Performs a backup create cast to the scheduler or to the backup manager. This which will signal a transition of the api workflow to another child and/or related workflow on another component. Reversion strategy: N/A """ def __init__(self, backup_rpcapi, db): super(BackupCastTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION]) self.db = db self.requires.update(['backup_id', 'volume_id', 'host']) def _cast_create_backup(self, context, request_spec): backup_id = request_spec['backup_id'] volume_id = request_spec['volume_id'] host = request_spec['host'] self.backup_rpcapi.create_backup( context, host, backup_id, volume_id) def __call__(self, context, **kwargs): request_spec = kwargs.copy() self._cast_create_backup(context, request_spec) class OnFailureChangeStatusTask(base.CinderTask): """Helper task that sets a volume id to status error. Reversion strategy: On failure of any flow that includes this task the volume id that is associated with this task will be have its status set to error. If a volume specification is provided and the type of that spec is a source volume said source volume will have its status status updated as well. """ def __init__(self, db): super(OnFailureChangeStatusTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION]) self.db = db self.requires.update(['backup_id']) self.optional.update(['backup_spec']) def __call__(self, context, volume_id, volume_spec=None): # Save these items since we only use them if a reversion is triggered. return { 'volume_id': volume_id, 'backup_spec': backup_spec, } def revert(self, context, result, cause): backup_spec = result.get('backup_spec') if not backup_spec: # Attempt to use it from a later task that *should* have populated # this from the database. It is not needed to be found since # reverting will continue without it. backup_spec = _find_result_spec(cause.flow) # Restore the source volume status and set the volume to error status. volume_id = result['volume_id'] _restore_volume_status(context, self.db, backup_spec) _error_out_backup(context, self.db, backup_id, reason=cause.exc) LOG.error(_("Backup %s: create failed"), backup_id) exc_info = False if all(cause.exc_info): exc_info = cause.exc_info LOG.error(_('Unexpected build error:'), exc_info=exc_info) class ExtractBackupSpecTask(base.CinderTask): """Extracts a spec of a backup to be created into a common structure. This task extracts and organizes the input requirements into a common and easier to analyze structure for later tasks to use. It will also attach the underlying database backup reference which can be used by other tasks to reference for further details about the backup to be. Reversion strategy: N/A """ def __init__(self, db): super(ExtractBackupSpecTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION]) self.db = db self.requires.update(['backup_id']) self.provides.update(['backup_spec', 'backup_ref']) def __call__(self, context, backup_id, **kwargs): backup_ref = self.db.backup_get(context, backup_id) backup_name = backup_refs['name'] backup_size = utils.as_int(backup_ref['size'], quiet=False) # Create a dictionary that will represent the backup to be so that # later tasks can easily create the backup according to the # specifications (which are represented in this dictionary). specs = { 'status': backup_ref['status'], 'backup_id': volume_ref['id'], 'backup_name': backup_name, 'backup_size': backup_size, 'type': 'raw' } return { 'backup_spec': specs, 'backup_ref': backup_ref, } class NotifyBackupActionTask(base.CinderTask): """Performs a notification about the given backup when called. Reversion strategy: N/A """ def __init__(self, db, host, event_suffix): super(NotifyVolumeActionTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION, event_suffix]) self.requires.update(['backup_ref']) self.db = db self.event_suffix = event_suffix self.host = host def __call__(self, context, backup_ref): backup_id = backup_ref['id'] usage_info = dict(tenant_id=backup_ref['project_id'], user_id=backup_ref['user_id'], availability_zone=backup_ref['availability_zone'], backup_id=backup_id, volume_id=backup_ref['volume_id'], display_name=backup_ref['display_name'], status=backup_ref['status'], size=backup_ref['size']) try: notifier.notify(context, 'backup.%s' % self.host, 'backup.%s' % event_suffix, notifier.INFO, usage_info) except exception.CinderException: # If notification sending of backup database entry reading fails # then we shouldn't error out the whole workflow since this is # not always information that must be sent for backups to operate LOG.exception(_("Failed notifying about the backup" " action %(event)s for backup %(backup_id)s") % {'event': self.event_suffix, 'backup_id': backup_id}) class CreateBackupFromSpecTask(base.CinderTask): """Creates a backup from a provided specification. Reversion strategy: N/A """ def __init__(self, db, host, driver, backup_service): super(CreateBackupFromSpecTask, self).__init__(addons=[ACTION]) self.db = db self.driver = driver self.backup_service = backup_service self.requires.update(['backup_spec', 'backup_ref']) # This maps the different backup specification types into the methods # that can create said backup type (aka this is a jump table). self._create_func_mapping = { 'raw': self._create_raw_backup, } self.host = host self.volume_api = cinder.volume.API() def _extract_volume(self, context, volume_id): volume = self.volume_api.get(context, volume_id) if volume['status'] != "available": msg = _('Volume to be backed up must be available') raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) return volume def _create_raw_backup(self, context, backup_ref, **kwargs): self.driver.backup_volume(context, backup_ref, self.backup_service) def __call__(self, context, backup_ref, backup_spec): create_type = backup_spec.pop('type', None) create_functor = self._create_func_mapping.get(create_type) if not create_functor: raise exception.BackupTypeNotFound(backup_type_id=create_type) backup_spec = dict(backup_spec) backup_id = backup_spec.pop('backup_id', None) if not backup_id: backup_id = backup_ref['id'] LOG.info(_("Backup %(backup_id)s: being created using %(functor)s " "with specification: %(backup_spec)s") % {'backup_spec': backup_spec, 'backup_id': backup_id, 'functor': _make_pretty_name(create_functor)}) backup_ref['host'] = self.host self.db.backup_update(context, backup_id, {'host': self.host, 'service': self.backup_service}) expected_status = 'backing-up' volume_id = backup_ref['volume_id'] volume_ref = self._extract_volume(context, volume_id) if volume_ref['status'] != expected_status: err = _('create_backup aborted, expected volume status ' '%(expected_status)s but got %(actual_status)s') % { 'expected_status': expected_status, 'actual_status': volume_ref['status'], } self.db.backup_update(context, backup_id, {'status': 'error', 'fail_reason': err}) raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=err) expected_status = 'creating' if backup_ref['status'] != expected_status: err = _('create_backup aborted, expected backup status ' '%(expected_status)s but got %(actual_status)s') % { 'expected_status': expected_status, 'actual_status': backup_ref['status'], } self.db.volume_update(context, volume_id, {'status': 'available'}) self.db.backup_update(context, backup_id, {'status': 'error', 'fail_reason': err}) raise exception.InvalidBackup(reason=err) create_functor(context, backup_ref=backup_ref, **backup_spec) class CreateBackupOnFinishTask(NotifyVolumeActionTask): """On successful backup creation this will perform final backup actions. When a backup is created successfully it is expected that MQ notifications and database updates will occur to 'signal' to others that the backup is now ready for usage. This task does those notifications and updates in a reliable manner (not re-raising exceptions if said actions can not be triggered). Reversion strategy: N/A """ def __init__(self, db, host, event_suffix): super(CreateBackupOnFinishTask, self).__init__(db, host, event_suffix) self.requires.update(['backup_spec']) def __call__(self, context, backup_ref, backup_spec): backup_id = backup_ref['id'] update = {'status': 'available'} try: # TODO(harlowja): is it acceptable to only log if this fails?? # or are there other side-effects that this will cause if the # status isn't updated correctly (aka it will likely be stuck in # 'building' if this fails)?? backup_ref = self.db.backup_update(context, backup_id, update) # Now use the parent to notify. super(CreatebackupOnFinishTask, self).__call__(context, backup_ref) except exception.CinderException: LOG.exception(_("Failed updating backup %(backup_id)s with " "%(update)s") % {'backup_id': backup_id, 'update': update}) # Even if the update fails, the backup is ready. msg = _("Backup %(backup_name)s (%(backup_id)s): created successfully") LOG.info(msg % { 'backup_name': backup_spec['backup_name'], 'backup_id': backup_id, }) def _attach_debug_listeners(flow): """Sets up a nice set of debug listeners for the flow. These listeners will log when tasks/flows are transitioning from state to state so that said states can be seen in the debug log output which is very useful for figuring out where problems are occuring. """ def flow_log_change(state, details): # TODO(harlowja): the bug 1214083 is causing problems LOG.debug(_("%(flow)s has moved into state %(state)s from state" " %(old_state)s") % {'state': state, 'old_state': details.get('old_state'), 'flow': str(details['flow'])}) def task_log_change(state, details): # TODO(harlowja): the bug 1214083 is causing problems LOG.debug(_("%(flow)s has moved %(runner)s into state %(state)s with" " result: %(result)s") % {'state': state, 'flow': str(details['flow']), 'runner': str(details['runner']), 'result': details.get('result')}) # Register * for all state changes (and not selective state changes to be # called upon) since all the changes is more useful. flow.notifier.register('*', flow_log_change) flow.task_notifier.register('*', task_log_change) return flow def get_api_flow(backup_rpcapi, db, service_check_functor, create_what): """Constructs and returns the api entrypoint flow. This flow will do the following: 1. Inject keys & values for dependent tasks. 2. Extracts and validates the input keys & values. 3. Creates the database entry. 4. Casts to backup manager for further processing. """ flow_name = ACTION.replace(":", "_") + "_api" api_flow = linear_flow.Flow(flow_name) # This injects the initial starting flow values into the workflow so that # the dependency order of the tasks provides/requires can be correctly # determined. api_flow.add(base.InjectTask(create_what, addons=[ACTION])) api_flow.add(ExtractBackupRequestTask(service_check_functor)) v_uuid = api_flow.add(EntryCreateTask(db)) # If after committing something fails, ensure we set the db to failure # before reverting any prior tasks. api_flow.add(OnFailureChangeStatusTask(db)) # This will cast it out to the backup manager via the rpc apis provided. api_flow.add(BackupCastTask(backup_rpcapi, db)) # This will return the flow as well as the uuid of the # task which will produce the 'backup' database reference return (_attach_debug_listeners(api_flow), v_uuid) def get_manager_flow(db, driver, backup_service, host, volume_id, request_spec=None): """Constructs and returns the manager entrypoint flow. This flow will do the following: 1. Inject keys & values for dependent tasks. 2. Selects activated only on *failure* task (to update the db status & notify). 3. Extracts a backup specification from the provided inputs. 4. Notifies that the backup has start to be created. 5. Creates a backup from the extracted backup specification. 6. When backup creation has ended performs further database status updates. """ flow_name = ACTION.replace(":", "_") + "_manager" backup_flow = linear_flow.Flow(flow_name) # This injects the initial starting flow values into the workflow so that # the dependency order of the tasks provides/requires can be correctly # determined. backup_flow.add(base.InjectTask({ 'volume_id': volume_id, }, addons=[ACTION])) backup_flow.add(OnFailureChangeStatusTask(db)) backup_flow.add(ExtractBackupSpecTask(db)) backup_flow.add(NotifyBackupActionTask(db, host, "create.start")) backup_flow.add(CreateBackupFromSpecTask(db, host, driver, backup_service)) backup_flow.add(CreateBackupOnFinishTask(db, host, "create.end")) return _attach_debug_listeners(backup_flow)

commit_message:
Optional dependency injection

This adds support for optional dependencies using Keystone
dependency injection.

A new decorator for classes is provided.

 @dependency.optional('optional_api_1', 'optional_api_2')

If there's a provider for the dependency, the attribute
will be set to the provider instance, otherwise the attribute
will be set to None.

This can be used in combination with required dependencies.

Related-bug: #1223524
Change-Id: I2b987f10a7bc85efab136ae9e84606e666494246
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/63/46363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _future_optionals = {} for dependency in getattr(self, '_dependencies', []): for dependency in getattr(self, '_optionals', []): if dependency not in REGISTRY: if dependency in _future_optionals: _future_optionals[dependency] += [self] else: _future_optionals[dependency] = [self] continue setattr(self, dependency, REGISTRY[dependency]) def optional(*dependencies): """Optionally inject specified dependencies from the registry into the instance. """ def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): """Inject each dependency from the registry.""" self.__wrapped_init__(*args, **kwargs) for dependency in getattr(self, '_dependencies', []): if dependency not in REGISTRY: if dependency in _future_dependencies: _future_dependencies[dependency] += [self] else: _future_dependencies[dependency] = [self] continue setattr(self, dependency, REGISTRY[dependency]) for dependency in getattr(self, '_optionals', []): if dependency not in REGISTRY: if dependency in _future_optionals: _future_optionals[dependency] += [self] else: _future_optionals[dependency] = [self] continue setattr(self, dependency, REGISTRY[dependency]) def wrapped(cls): """Note the optional dependencies on the object for later injection. The dependencies of the parent class are combined with that of the child class to create a new set of dependencies. """ existing_optionals = getattr(cls, '_optionals', set()) cls._optionals = existing_optionals.union(dependencies) if not hasattr(cls, '__wrapped_init__'): cls.__wrapped_init__ = cls.__init__ cls.__init__ = wrapper return cls return wrapped for dependency, targets in _future_optionals.iteritems(): provider = REGISTRY.get(dependency) for target in targets: setattr(target, dependency, provider) _future_optionals.clear() _future_optionals.clear()

commit_message:
Fix help messages for name arguments

Users can specify the name of an instance as the argument, which are
passed through find_resource(), instead of the id.
This patch changes some help messages for explaining this behavior.

Related-Bug: #1220590

Change-Id: I9af1259af4319b82b94d7b28536def3107ec5dd5

commit_message:
Improve test coverage of stack deletion

Adding tests to cover stack deletion timeout, stack deletion
failure and also to cover check_delete_complete.

Fixes bug #1220723

Change-Id: I50dbaf37f6d95b731e8496aa90c6c6e5bcc27ab1

commit_message:
Modify oauth1 tests to use generated keystone token in a call

Expanded on a test to check roles section for returned token too,
as well as using the returned token to issue a request (create user).

Change-Id: Id3e88e98aa69c0a353ca54a3d4a29cdade34939a

commit_message:
Fix FWaaS plugin to allow one firewall per tenant

The reference implementation of the FWaaS iptables
agent/driver supports only one firewall per tenant
in Havana release. However, the FWaaS plugin will
let you create more than one firewall. This is
being fixed in this patch to not allow creating
the second firewall if a firewall already exists
for the tenant.

Change-Id: I8f1cad9791723ba919b5774a63982c204686ddfe
Closes-Bug: #1228442

commit_message:
VMware: Handles no datastores case

If the host does not have datastores mounted or is in maintenance mode
then it reports empty datastores list. Modified code to ignore such cases.

Fixes bug: 1229653

Change-Id: I8f076d7b652181988b45738664a0d549c0b5ff9b

The dynamic evaluation of requires_deferred_auth will not work

commit_message:
StackResource set requires_deferred_auth=True

The dynamic evaluation of requires_deferred_auth will not work
as the nested stack has not been created when requires_deferred_auth
is evaluated.

In some cases subclasses of StackResource could implement dynamic
evaluation but for now it is safer to assume any template with a
nested stack needs requires_deferred_auth=True

Change-Id: I4ca3804ede5c7aa2167931279e5bed84480ac454
Closes-Bug: #1229412
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/48/47948/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Port Cisco nexus subplugin UT to ML2 mech driver UT

Fixes bug 1227889

This fix ports the Cisco Nexus sub-plugin unit tests
(neutron/tests/unit/cisco/test_nexus_plugin.py) to the Cisco ML2 mechanism
driver. The new test script will be
neutron/tests/unit/ml2/drivers/test_cisco_nexus.py.

Test cases which will be excluded from this port:
    - Test cases involving provider networks.
    - Test cases involving add/remove router networks
since these features are not currently supported in the Cisco ML2
mechanism driver.

Change-Id: I7aed85031cf402c418089d263c7e949c4631b1eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/47492/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import collections import mock import testtools from neutron.db import api as db from neutron.openstack.common import importutils from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco import constants from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco import exceptions from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco import mech_cisco_nexus from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco import nexus_db_v2 from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco import nexus_network_driver from neutron.tests import base NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS = '1.1.1.1' NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS_PC = '2.2.2.2' HOST_NAME_1 = 'testhost1' HOST_NAME_2 = 'testhost2' HOST_NAME_PC = 'testpchost' INSTANCE_1 = 'testvm1' INSTANCE_2 = 'testvm2' INSTANCE_PC = 'testpcvm' NEXUS_PORT_1 = '1/10' NEXUS_PORT_2 = '1/20' NEXUS_PORTCHANNELS = 'portchannel:2' VLAN_ID_1 = 267 VLAN_ID_2 = 265 VLAN_ID_PC = 268 DEVICE_OWNER = 'compute:test' NEXUS_SSH_PORT = '22' NEXUS_DRIVER = ('neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco.' 'nexus_network_driver.CiscoNexusDriver') class FakeNetworkContext(object): """Network context for testing purposes only.""" def __init__(self, segment_id): self._network_segments = [{'segmentation_id': segment_id}] @property def network_segments(self): return self._network_segments class FakePortContext(object): """Port context for testing purposes only.""" def __init__(self, device_id, network_context): self._port = { 'device_id': device_id, 'device_owner': DEVICE_OWNER } self._network = network_context @property def current(self): return self._port @property def network(self): return self._network class TestCiscoNexusDevice(base.BaseTestCase): """Unit tests for Cisco ML2 Nexus device driver.""" TestConfigObj = collections.namedtuple( 'TestConfigObj', 'nexus_ip_addr host_name nexus_port instance_id vlan_id') test_configs = { 'test_config1': TestConfigObj( NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS, HOST_NAME_1, NEXUS_PORT_1, INSTANCE_1, VLAN_ID_1), 'test_config2': TestConfigObj( NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS, HOST_NAME_2, NEXUS_PORT_2, INSTANCE_2, VLAN_ID_2), 'test_config_portchannel': TestConfigObj( NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS_PC, HOST_NAME_PC, NEXUS_PORTCHANNELS, INSTANCE_PC, VLAN_ID_PC), } test_credentials = { NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS: { constants.USERNAME: 'admin', constants.PASSWORD: 'pass1234' }, NEXUS_IP_ADDRESS_PC: { constants.USERNAME: 'admin', constants.PASSWORD: 'password' }, } def setUp(self): """Sets up mock ncclient, and switch and credentials dictionaries.""" super(TestCiscoNexusDevice, self).setUp() # Use a mock netconf client mock_ncclient = mock.Mock() mock.patch.object(nexus_network_driver.CiscoNexusDriver, '_import_ncclient', return_value=mock_ncclient).start() def new_nexus_init(self): self.driver = importutils.import_object(NEXUS_DRIVER) self._nexus_switches = {} for name, config in TestCiscoNexusDevice.test_configs.items(): ip_addr = config.nexus_ip_addr host_name = config.host_name nexus_port = config.nexus_port self._nexus_switches[(ip_addr, host_name)] = nexus_port self._nexus_switches[(ip_addr, 'ssh_port')] = NEXUS_SSH_PORT self.driver.nexus_switches = self._nexus_switches self.driver.credentials = TestCiscoNexusDevice.test_credentials db.configure_db() with mock.patch.object(mech_cisco_nexus.CiscoNexusMechanismDriver, '__init__', new=new_nexus_init): self._cisco_mech_driver = (mech_cisco_nexus. CiscoNexusMechanismDriver()) self.addCleanup(mock.patch.stopall) self.addCleanup(db.clear_db) def _create_delete_port(self, port_config): """Tests creation and deletion of a virtual port.""" nexus_ip_addr = port_config.nexus_ip_addr host_name = port_config.host_name nexus_port = port_config.nexus_port instance_id = port_config.instance_id vlan_id = port_config.vlan_id network_context = FakeNetworkContext(vlan_id) port_context = FakePortContext(instance_id, network_context) with mock.patch.object(mech_cisco_nexus.CiscoNexusMechanismDriver, '_get_instance_host') as mock_host: mock_host.return_value = host_name self._cisco_mech_driver.create_port_postcommit(port_context) bindings = nexus_db_v2.get_nexusport_binding(nexus_port, vlan_id, nexus_ip_addr, instance_id) self.assertEqual(len(bindings), 1) self._cisco_mech_driver.delete_port_precommit(port_context) with testtools.ExpectedException( exceptions.NexusPortBindingNotFound): nexus_db_v2.get_nexusport_binding(nexus_port, vlan_id, nexus_ip_addr, instance_id) def test_create_delete_ports(self): """Tests creation and deletion of two new virtual Ports.""" self._create_delete_port( TestCiscoNexusDevice.test_configs['test_config1']) self._create_delete_port( TestCiscoNexusDevice.test_configs['test_config2']) def test_create_delete_portchannel(self): """Tests creation of a port over a portchannel.""" self._create_delete_port( TestCiscoNexusDevice.test_configs['test_config_portchannel'])

commit_message:
port test_absolute_limits into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. This is being tried in order to make
reviewing of the porting easier as gerrit will display only what
is actually changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: If7329c8d9296cf498d02863a84047b46bf7f0ba9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/88/47888/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json from tempest.common.rest_client import RestClient class LimitsClientJSON(RestClient): def __init__(self, config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name=None): super(LimitsClientJSON, self).__init__(config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name) self.service = self.config.compute.catalog_type def get_absolute_limits(self): resp, body = self.get("limits") body = json.loads(body) return resp, body['limits']['absolute'] def get_specific_absolute_limit(self, absolute_limit): resp, body = self.get("limits") body = json.loads(body) if absolute_limit not in body['limits']['absolute']: return None else: return body['limits']['absolute'][absolute_limit]

commit_message:
Move tests in keystoneclient

This is the suggested location for tests and is adopted by most
projects. As part of this change relative imports to package imports.

Fix all the test running and coverage code to point to the new location.

Change-Id: I01264aed14f396ab9a7242e3e72b71e1bc332675

subject: update SLO delete error handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-01 20:53:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/5172e1c36f2f174bacddb6e73d0f52cda4191b23', 'message': 'raise HTTPNotFound on missing SLO manifest

If the SLO manifest in the request is missing, the request should return
a 404 response. Also, missing segments within the manifest should be
added back to the objects to be deleted, so the bulk delete response can
report they were missing.

commit_message:
update SLO delete error handling

* ensure all responses are 200 OK
* report missing sub-SLO manifests or other error messages in bulk
  delete response

Change-Id: Iaf88c94bc7114ff3c9751f9f31f8f748de911f8a

added_lines: if env['PATH_INFO'].startswith('/test_delete_missing/'): good_data = json.dumps( [{'name': '/c/a_1', 'hash': 'a', 'bytes': '1'}, {'name': '/d/b_2', 'hash': 'b', 'bytes': '2'}]) self.req_method_paths.append((env['REQUEST_METHOD'], env['PATH_INFO'])) if env['PATH_INFO'].endswith('/c/man_missing'): return Response(status=404)(env, start_response) if env['PATH_INFO'].endswith('/c/a_1'): return Response(status=404)(env, start_response) return Response(status=200, headers={'X-Static-Large-Object': 'True'}, body=good_data)(env, start_response) def test_handle_multipart_delete_man_missing(self): req = Request.blank( '/test_delete_missing/A/c/man_missing?multipart-manifest=delete', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'DELETE'}) app_iter = self.slo(req.environ, fake_start_response) list(app_iter) # iterate through whole response self.assertEquals(self.app.calls, 1) self.assertEquals(self.app.req_method_paths, [('GET', '/test_delete_missing/A/c/man_missing')]) def test_handle_multipart_delete_sub_missing(self): req = Request.blank( '/test_delete_missing/A/c/man?multipart-manifest=delete', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'DELETE', 'HTTP_ACCEPT': 'application/json'}) app_iter = self.slo(req.environ, fake_start_response) app_iter = list(app_iter) # iterate through whole response resp_data = json.loads(app_iter[0]) self.assertEquals(self.app.calls, 4) self.assertEquals(self.app.req_method_paths, [('GET', '/test_delete_missing/A/c/man'), ('DELETE', '/test_delete_missing/A/c/a_1'), ('DELETE', '/test_delete_missing/A/d/b_2'), ('DELETE', '/test_delete_missing/A/c/man')]) self.assertEquals(resp_data['Response Status'], '200 OK') self.assertEquals(resp_data['Number Deleted'], 2) self.assertEquals(resp_data['Number Not Found'], 1)

commit_message:
Moved registration of lifcycle events handler in init_host()

The callback for handling lifecycle events now gets registered
before libvirt version is checked.  This is necesary because the
callback must be registered before the first time the connection
to libvirt is used.

Closes-bug: #1220278.

Change-Id: Id3a06c497d088078b4ea678ec9dde23bf0f406d4

commit_message:
Properly synchronize status for ports deleted from backend

Ensure that the status for a port is properly synchronized even
when the port itself does not exist anymore in the backend, avoiding
raising exceptions due to missing results in the NVP query.

This patch also adjusts a comment and improves exception handling
in _nvp_get_port_id

Bug 1229331

Change-Id: Ibaa581006c994a543c1795dd3f1d50086583b953

commit_message:
Fix NetApp iscsi drivers for cinder backup

It fixes the iscsi drivers to query backend
if a lun entry is not found in the cache. Due
to the c-bak feature spawning volume drivers
separately than c-vol it caused NetApp drivers
to error out if volume was created after starting
c-bak. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I3570e58560408d3f7117bb1068cf530ae05521b3
Closes-Bug:#1229620

commit_message:
Fix check for mount.nfs helper installation

This fixes the issue for checking the
existence of mount.nfs helper program
in installation directories during
driver set up.

Closes-Bug:#1212286

Change-Id: If2fa925614bd42295eae0f62ba948e14a89e1343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/94/47094/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check if mount.nfs is installed nfs_helper_paths = ["/bin/mount.nfs", "/sbin/mount.nfs", "/usr/bin/mount.nfs", "/usr/sbin/mount.nfs"] path_found = False for path in nfs_helper_paths: if os.path.exists(path): path_found = True break if not path_found: raise exception.NfsException('mount.nfs is not installed')
deleted_lines: try: self._execute('mount.nfs', check_exit_code=False) except OSError as exc: if exc.errno == errno.ENOENT: raise exception.NfsException('mount.nfs is not installed') else: raise

commit_message:
Allow v2 Volume API to create volume with type name

v2 API only accepts volume type ID when creating volume, while v1
API allows both volume type name and ID (volume type name is unique
in Cinder). This patch enables v2 API to accept volume type name
as create() parameter. Aslo volume type validation code block
in v1 API create() is refactored to a slimmer version.

Change-Id: I4ee98b67a0a0e98ff4d402749e12b1335d45f64d
Close-bug: 1228835
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/86/47986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Update rootwrap with code from oslo

3663010 rootwrap: improve Python 3 compatibility
28395d9 Fixes files with wrong bitmode

commit_message:
Fix processutils.execute errors on Windows

This fix is related to oslo-incubator commit:
d6a963e911b8456c06dceb5ee3cc88a70c08bf82

This patchset has been generated with:

cd oslo-incubator
python update.py ../cinder/openstack-common.conf

Fixes bug: #1209410

Change-Id: I2dfba72cf602409308049fbbba825506f51355ef

commit_message:
Remove exceptions.Duplicate

exceptions.Duplicate is largely unused (one fake and one use in
cloudpipe). We should replace those users with more specific
exceptions and then remove exceptions.Duplicate.

Closes-Bug: 1228953
Change-Id: I0e7b4bae5728600fb81511a05778419b3e5577df

commit_message:
Add user to project if project ID is changed

When an user updates project ID, it is necessary to make sure
the new tenant is available.

Remove the member role from the old tenant.

Add the member role to the new tenant.

Fixes bug 1201251

Change-Id: I0c2c8971039f567180fd910e959e4a1f0574034d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/26/42826/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check tenantId if want to update it if 'tenantId' in user: try: self.identity_api.add_user_to_project( user.get('tenantId'), user_id) except exception.Conflict: # we're already a member of that tenant pass

subject: Use name property in OS::Nova::Server if set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-24 02:49:29.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/server.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/cd5d149a6bf9773b865ead267ddbccbe91b8dc54', 'message': 'Use name property in OS::Nova::Server if set

Currently the name property is ignored if specified; the intention

Closes-Bug: #1229244

commit_message:
Use name property in OS::Nova::Server if set

Currently the name property is ignored if specified; the intention
was to use the name as the nova server name if specified.

This is implemented by overriding physical_resource_name
in the same way as SwiftContainer.

Change-Id: I06a6f3d69119fb470eb54930c2bd7b329cabd6c7

commit_message:
Fix swift httpd on fedora

Implements a fedora equivalent of ubuntu's sites-enabled and moves
enabling of mod_wsgi to the installation period so that it doesn't have
to be handled in a platform dependant way later.

Fixes: bug 1226363
Change-Id: I85325179f1792d985b0375572abfe8c8a82fecc3

commit_message:
Type check for Message param to avoid AttributeError

Setting the locale iteratively on Messages within a Message may cause an
AttributeError when trying to set the locale on a message substitution
that is thought to be a dict() but may be anything.

Currently even the following code would be a problem:
    msg =  _('This is a message: %s') % 'Hi'

Closes-bug: #1229364

Change-Id: I6fe55ebc4eea5fef1d335ad83a84c4879f7f06f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/11/47911/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: for param in self.params.values(): if isinstance(param, Message): param.locale = value

commit_message:
Implemented start_power_state_change In Conductor

The start_power_state_change function in the conductor manager
allows the client to turn the power on or off for a baremetal node

Change-Id: I989a2ec60d71c55d42b14e4e2d8c8cbf8ce97151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/93/43193/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 International Business Machines Corporation Perform actions such as power on, power off. The node's power_state will be updated with the new state if succesful. :param context: an admin context. :param node_obj: an RPC-style node object. :param new_state: the desired power state of the node. :returns: the node object with new power_state set to be 'power on', 'power off' or 'error'. :raises: InvalidParameterValue when the wrong state is specified or the wrong driver info is specified. :raises: NodeInWrongPowerState when the node is in the state. that cannot perform and requested power action. :raises: other exceptins by the node's power driver if something wrong during the power action. : node_id = node_obj.get('uuid') LOG.debug("RPC start_power_state_change called for node %s." % node_id) if new_state not in [states.POWER_ON, states.POWER_OFF]: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(_("start_power_state called " "with invalid power state %s.") % new_state) with task_manager.acquire(node_id, shared=False) as task: #an exception will be raised if validate fails. task.driver.power.validate(node_obj) curr_state = task.driver.power.get_power_state(task, node_obj) if curr_state == new_state: raise exception.NodeInWrongPowerState( node=node_id, pstate=curr_state) else: task.driver.power.set_power_state(task, node_obj, new_state) ret_state = task.driver.power.get_power_state(task, node_obj) node_obj['power_state'] = ret_state # update the node power status node_obj.save(context) return node_obj
deleted_lines: Perform actions such as power on and power off. TODO :param context: an admin context :param node_obj: an RPC-style node object :param new_state: the desired power state of the node pass

subject: Fix AttributeError in Keypair._add_details()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-17 08:02:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/29698a1521063128eb5474d16a61a3be8716ee59', 'message': "Fix AttributeError in Keypair._add_details()

_add_details() method copies keypair attributes retrieved
from Nova to an instance of Keypair class. Trying to set
attribute 'id' fails with AttributeError, because Keypair
class has a read-only property 'id'.

We can safely omit setting of attribute 'id', because it's
just an implementation detail (the id of a table row in a
database), and keypairs for a given tenant are uniquely
identified using attribute 'name'.

Fixes bug 1223934

Change-Id: I1045730e47e9e6ad31fcdfbaefdad77e2f3b2c3e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-24 07:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/keypairs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/9e8dd063c6c4215ebda25d0199cec3fb64a81837', 'message': "Fix AttributeError in Keypair._add_details()

_add_details() method copies keypair attributes retrieved
from Nova to an instance of Keypair class. Trying to set
attribute 'id' fails with AttributeError, because Keypair
class has a read-only property 'id'.

We can safely omit setting of attribute 'id', because it's
just an implementation detail (the id of a table row in a
database), and keypairs for a given tenant are uniquely
identified using attribute 'name'.

Fixes bug 1223934

Change-Id: I1045730e47e9e6ad31fcdfbaefdad77e2f3b2c3e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in Keypair._add_details()

_add_details() method copies keypair attributes retrieved
from Nova to an instance of Keypair class. Trying to set
attribute 'id' fails with AttributeError, because Keypair
class has a read-only property 'id'.

We can safely omit setting of attribute 'id', because it's
just an implementation detail (the id of a table row in a
database), and keypairs for a given tenant are uniquely
identified using attribute 'name'.

Fixes bug 1223934

Change-Id: I1045730e47e9e6ad31fcdfbaefdad77e2f3b2c3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/97/46897/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if k == 'id': # NOTE(rpodolyaka): keypair name allows us to uniquely identify # a specific keypair, while its id attribute # is nothing more than an implementation # detail. We can safely omit the id attribute # here to ensure setattr() won't raise # AttributeError trying to set read-only # property id continue

commit_message:
Add debugging to ComputeCapabilitiesFilter

When ComputeCapabilitiesFilter fails to match an extra_spec its hard to
debug which requirement is missing, add a LOG.debug statement to make
life easier.

Change-Id: I5d24d6ceee92611af112c2fbac1564cc3f9bf838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/46847/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: disassociate_address response should match ec2
revisions: [{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-12 03:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ab55af8ed5afd0765a23a85d608d4b6d35bdd166', 'message': 'disassociate_address response should match ec2 The current behavior of disassociate_address does not match that of what EC2 would return when calling it upon an unassociated address. In EC2 when disassociate_address is called on an unassociated address, it returns successfully as such: aabbccdd-0146-4952-bdbe-710e4fee8387 true However, when this same called is made against the OpenStack EC2 implementation, this would return a 400: InvalidInstanceID.NotFound Instance None could not be found. req-7a9b4d03-b9f5-4243-95d8-f1ccab180631 This is due to the fact that we continue to attempt disassociation despite instance_id == None. Modify this behavior to match EC2 by simply checking that instance_id is set before continuing disassociation. Else, bail early, and in either case report success. This change also modifies unit tests to account for this change. Change-Id: I17c822d70918fefa55da2ab096af5b98b87e23e7 Closes-Bug: #1224251 '}]
commit_message: disassociate_address response should match ec2 The current behavior of disassociate_address does not match that of what EC2 would return when calling it upon an unassociated address. In EC2 when disassociate_address is called on an unassociated address, it returns successfully as such: aabbccdd-0146-4952-bdbe-710e4fee8387 true However, when this same called is made against the OpenStack EC2 implementation, this would return a 400: InvalidInstanceID.NotFound Instance None could not be found. req-7a9b4d03-b9f5-4243-95d8-f1ccab180631 This is due to the fact that we continue to attempt disassociation despite instance_id == None. Modify this behavior to match EC2 by simply checking that instance_id is set before continuing disassociation. Else, bail early, and in either case report success. This change also modifies unit tests to account for this change. Change-Id: I17c822d70918fefa55da2ab096af5b98b87e23e7 Closes-Bug: #1224251
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/46185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance_id: instance = self.compute_api.get(context, instance_id) LOG.audit(_("Disassociate address %s"), public_ip, context=context) self.network_api.disassociate_floating_ip(context, instance, address=public_ip)
deleted_lines: instance = self.compute_api.get(context, instance_id) LOG.audit(_("Disassociate address %s"), public_ip, context=context) self.network_api.disassociate_floating_ip(context, instance, address=public_ip)

commit_message:
Enable test_create_multiple_servers test for V3 API

Now that the multiple create extension has merged we can enable
this test for the V3 API. Need to also override post_server
for the test client for the V3 API as the data return when requesting
a reservation id in the V3 API has changed

Change-Id: I7f34f1e90b872c4679b5c54fe9e4b0f4420910ab
Closes-Bug: #1206884
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/45804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
disable direct mounting of qcow2 images by default

* nova/virt/disk/api.py: Set the default for the
'resize_fs_using_block_device' option to False,
so that we don't enable this functionality because:
1. It's not needed for newer images that resize themselves.
2. It enables direct mounting of images which might otherwise
   be disabled for security reasons.
3. It's not supported on systems without the nbd module.
4. It gives noisy diagnostics on such systems.

Fixes bug: 1212734

Change-Id: Ifbd687eae46606176ea196888eeffdde08559c01

Revert "Update oslo.config"

This reverts commit 2b3da5e312a2ab94cf3a46183bdd4299acbb7129

We shouldn't release a version of keystoneclient to pypi which
requires a version of oslo.config which isn't on pypi.

Also, keystoneclient doesn't actually require any new
oslo.config APIs.

Change-Id: I271c2f83087c7d6e07a2e3236568935bfd3c33ae

commit_message:
service: check that timestamps are almost equals

Sometimes timestamp get rounded during conversions and fails. Let's use
assertAlmostEqual to be safe.

Change-Id: I79e935d4b54013a18d2e07e71411f2ead94d977f
Fixes-Bug: #1223346

commit_message:
Convert TestCases to NoDBTestCase

NoDBTestCase is faster because it skips initializing a database for
tests which don't actually talk to the database. Its also nicer
because its more explicit about the dependancies of a given test.
This is the final pass at moving test cases over to the database
lacking version.

Change-Id: Iba5ec1f5c0a5724f01779eb5b0f164c4e232632a
Closes-Bug: 1227473

commit_message:
Convert TestCases to NoDBTestCase

NoDBTestCase is faster because it skips initializing a database for
tests which don't actually talk to the database. Its also nicer
because its more explicit about the dependancies of a given test.
This is a third pass at moving test cases over to the database
lacking version, but further work is required here.

Change-Id: Ibbe86329c846e9d6df16f3bbe53a75efff6fd604
Partial-Bug: 1227473

commit_message:
Convert TestCases to NoDBTestCase

NoDBTestCase is faster because it skips initializing a database for
tests which don't actually talk to the database. Its also nicer
because its more explicit about the dependancies of a given test.
This is a second pass at moving test cases over to the database
lacking version, but further work is required here.

Partial-Bug: 1227473

Change-Id: I16313b8febb8a3c681fdf7e7278cc5a09138e542

commit_message:
Move test_default_limits to the new tests location

This test apparently landed in the wrong package after the tests well
re-factored. Moving it to the right location.

Implements blueprint refactor-system-tests

Change-Id: I4d01772afce669f42e4d4693ff72d55bea5438ef

commit_message:
Make auth backend use OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE parameter from settings.

And if parameter is missing in dashboard's settings, use default value of
'publicURL'. This default value doesn't fit documentation at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html#openstack-endpoint-type,
but as lin-hua.cheng@hp.com said (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45679/) documentation should
be fixed itself.

More tests were added: same checks for V2 and V3 are also run for
three possible values of settings.OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE ('publicURL',
'internalURL' and 'adminURL'). Old test suites correspond to
settings.OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE parameter not being set.

Closes-bug: #1221563
Change-Id: Ic164d1cfcb0c7606c7ca51b869a738b2976bf6ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/55/45655/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: endpoint_type = getattr( settings, 'OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE', 'internalURL') user = create_user_from_token( request, Token(auth_ref), client.service_catalog.url_for(endpoint_type=endpoint_type))

subject: VMwareVCDriver Fix sparse disk copy error on spawn
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-28 05:56:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b40040d6d58c162bf88a5d3b59d1f1f79afe9a25', 'message': "VMwareVCDriver: Fix instance create with sparse disk image

The same approach of calling VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk
without destination disk spec in the cluster driver for fixing 1184807
turns out to work for copying a sparse disk as well because the behavior
of vCenter's behavior for specless copy of a sparse disk is to do the
reasonable thing of converting a sparse disk to thin-provisioned, and a
flat disk to preallocated.

Tests done:

Verified using tempest that sparse/thin/preallocated image types deploys
properly through the cluster driver. Tempest output to be included in
the review comments.

Fixes bug 1171226

Change-Id: I6c48866e06c2aa656c89848564f3262fb7b79039
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-28 07:38:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8e4765513797f0d51056cef17a0a2cdd9bdbf65a', 'message': "VMwareVCDriver: Fix instance create with sparse disk image

The same approach of calling VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk
without destination disk spec in the cluster driver for fixing 1184807
turns out to work for copying a sparse disk as well because vCenter's behavior
for specless copy is to do the reasonable thing of converting a sparse disk to
thin-provisioned, and a flat disk to preallocated.

Tests done:

Verified using tempest that sparse/thin/preallocated image types deploys
properly through the cluster driver. Tempest output to be included in
the review comments.

Fixes bug 1171226

Change-Id: I6c48866e06c2aa656c89848564f3262fb7b79039

commit_message:
VMwareVCDriver Fix sparse disk copy error on spawn

The same approach of calling VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk
without destination disk spec in the cluster driver for fixing 1184807
turns out to work for copying a sparse disk as well because vCenter's behavior
for specless copy is to do the reasonable thing of converting a sparse disk to
thin-provisioned, and a flat disk to preallocated.

Tests done:

Verified using tempest that sparse/thin/preallocated image types deploys
properly through the cluster driver. Tempest output to be included in
the review comments.

Fixes bug 1171226

Change-Id: I6c48866e06c2aa656c89848564f3262fb7b79039
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/43994/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vmdk_copy_spec = self._get_copy_virtual_disk_spec(client_factory, adapter_type, disk_type) @staticmethod @staticmethod LOG.debug(_("Will copy disk with adapter type %(adapter_type)s " "and disk type %(disk_type)s without dest spec") % # disk and adapter type unchanged. The only exceptions are when the # source disk type is sparse or flat, in which case the destination # disk is converted to ESX-supported types of thin and preallocated # respectively.
deleted_lines: vmdk_copy_spec = vm_util.get_vmdk_create_spec(client_factory, vmdk_file_size_in_kb, adapter_type, disk_type) LOG.debug(_("Will copy while retaining adapter type " "%(adapter_type)s and disk type %(disk_type)s") % # disk and adapter type unchanged.

subject: Use oslo.config 1.2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-24 11:44:12.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'dev-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/2ac3211a551bba4f5e6f63caffb047197a9969b3', 'message': 'Use oslo.config 1.2.0

Now that oslo.config 1.2.0 final has been released, projects should stop
requiring the beta version.

Related-Bug: #1182861
Change-Id: Iadbcf27e64a5755e178fc81b5ee225aeb3914026
'}]
commit_message:
Use oslo.config 1.2.0

Now that oslo.config 1.2.0 final has been released, projects should stop
requiring the beta version.

Related-Bug: #1182861
Change-Id: Iadbcf27e64a5755e178fc81b5ee225aeb3914026
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/22/48022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Adds note that you can perform live migration within a cell
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-24 17:36:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/compute/section_compute-configure-migrations.xml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/8fcfa865b788f070df64038e18bff82cdeb95f83', 'message': 'Adds note that you can perform live migration within a cell

but not between cells

Change-Id: Iabf1c8bf7af689f3b6ed7b1802a5a66e5357ae66
Closes-bug: 1195565
'}]
commit_message:
Adds note that you can perform live migration within a cell

but not between cells

Change-Id: Iabf1c8bf7af689f3b6ed7b1802a5a66e5357ae66
Closes-bug: 1195565
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/01/48101/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <note> <para>This feature is for cloud administrators only. If your cloud is configured to use cells, you can perform live migration within a cell, but not between cells.</para> </note> <para><emphasis role="bold">Example Compute Installation Environment</emphasis> <itemizedlist>
deleted_lines: <note> <para>This feature is for cloud administrators only. </para> </note> <para><emphasis role="bold">Example Nova Installation Environment</emphasis> <itemizedlist>

commit_message:
Ensure any relevant tokens are revoked when a role is deleted

Add a controller class method to delete tokens for a role, along the
lines of those that exist for deleting tokens for user and project. Ensure
this is called for both the V2 and V3 delete_role APIs.

Fixes bug 1153645

Change-Id: I3c8d70eeb387a18c30df489142ea3aefc2224ae3

commit_message:
Fix V3 API server metadata XML serialization

The XML serialisation and deserialization when updating
a single server metadata item or retrieving a single server metadata
item through the V3 API is broken as the JSON format was changed
but the corresponding XML serialisation/deserialisation wasn't.

This changeset fixes this bug and adds testcases for the fixes.

Change-Id: I1bd2a729744387337f86a37dc2ff89606edce424
Closes-Bug: #1223803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/46069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from lxml import etreefrom nova.api.openstack import xmlutil class TestServerMetadataXMLDeserializer(test.TestCase): def test_update_deserializer(self): update_xml = ('<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>' '<metadata ' 'xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1" ' 'key="foo">Bar Value</metadata>') expected = {'metadata': { 'foo': 'Bar Value' } } deserializer = server_metadata.MetaItemDeserializer() result = deserializer.deserialize(update_xml) self.assertEqual(dict(body=expected), result) class TestServerMetadataXMLSerializer(test.TestCase): def test_show_serializer(self): metadata = {'metadata': { 'foo': 'Bar Value' } } serializer = server_metadata.MetaItemTemplate() output = serializer.serialize(metadata) res_tree = etree.XML(output) self.assertEqual(res_tree.tag, '{%s}metadata' % xmlutil.XMLNS_V11) self.assertEqual(len(res_tree), 0) self.assertEqual(res_tree.attrib['key'], 'foo') self.assertEqual(res_tree.text, 'Bar Value')

subject: Added 'page_size' param to image list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-22 09:26:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5a0d60f4697078d55addd3d6647d71614babaf3d', 'message': "Changed 'limit' to 'page_size' in image list

1. On an image list call, there is a feature to
limit the number of images, by passing in a
keyword - 'limit' as query params.
  But python-glanceclient does not understand
'limit' keywork on image list. It understands
a keyword - 'page_size' for the same intent.
  Changed to map 'limit' to 'page_size' param
while making a call to python-glanceclient in
GlanceImageService class.

2. Added a configuration 'glance_default_page_size'
defaulted to 100, to always limit image list call
made to python-glanceclient.

3. Changed StubGlanceClient.list() method to use
'page_size' keyword instead of 'limit', to make
it more accurate to python-glanceclient.

Fixes bug 1200233

Change-Id: I1c804c74c153e80bb572ec45283ebd9b6b7b41c5
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-29 15:07:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2d8b343c1227e909c79129bd8ee0cbf9eb3213f7', 'message': "Changed 'limit' to 'page_size' in image list

1. On an image list call, there is a feature to
limit the number of images, by passing in a
keyword - 'limit' as query params.

'limit' keywork on image list. It understands
a keyword - 'page_size' for the same intent.
  Changed to map 'limit' to 'page_size' param
while making a call to python-glanceclient in
GlanceImageService class.

2. Changed StubGlanceClient.list() method to use
'page_size' keyword instead of 'limit', to make
it more accurate to python-glanceclient.

Fixes bug 1200233

Change-Id: I1c804c74c153e80bb572ec45283ebd9b6b7b41c5
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-30 13:59:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a8301a98c0bae3c6a9ed244c0b4b7be9da514e88', 'message': "Added 'page_size' param to image list

1. Added a new query param called 'page_size' to
accepted_query_params list in image list call.
This param is passed on to glance-client which will
be used to paginate the result set.

2. Added page_size param to StubGlanceClient.list()
Now, the 'page_size' param is used to paginate the
results and 'limit' parameter is used to limit the
number of elements in result. This mimicks python-
glanceclient more closely now.

Fixes bug 1200233

commit_message:
Added 'page_size' param to image list

Added a new query param called 'page_size' to
accepted_query_params list in image list call.
This param is passed on to glance-client which will
be used to paginate the result set.

Fixes bug 1200233

Change-Id: I1c804c74c153e80bb572ec45283ebd9b6b7b41c5

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from oslo

Some Messages use a Message within a Message, and we were only
translating the base Message but not the Message substitution within.

Fixes bug: #1221808

Change-Id: Ic3119df23a090cfaa160c1461e955f0af55fe1cf

commit_message:
OpenStack services to support qpidd element

Configuration files are changed so that qpid is used
as the rpc_backend instead of kombu (rabbitmq) if it
is specified in the metadata.

Add qpid-python to Heat, Neutron, and Cinder
requirements.txt file. These elements install using
venv and don't use the system installed libraries.
These changes can be removed if requirements.txt is
changed upstream. There are two bugs tracking these
changes:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1225191
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1225232

Change-Id: I241a6cd411d4ad11a79a0e2adfb8b308e343e28d

commit_message:
VMware: fix bug with booting from volume

When booting from volume ensure that the volume is on the same
datastore as the instance being booted.

Fixes bug 1223709

Change-Id: Iddb70cdd7e358c401ef4f0b4d9e66b9655c2feeb

commit_message:
Install bridge-utils only if needed

The package bridge-utils is useful only if we have nova-network.
If we use Quantum, we don't have to install it.

This patch provides a condition "quantum_enabled" to check before the
installation of the package.

*Note* I replaced neutron with quantum because neutron does not exists.

Fix bug #1176087

Change-Id: Iee2ecbf2023ab211d67cb9bfeb3dbc5b4bb3eb89
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>

commit_message:
Disallow access/modify members of deleted image

It should not be possible to access or modify memberships for a
deleted image. A 404 error will now be returned if a deleted
images' members are accessed or modified.

Fixes: bug #1207266
Co-authored-by: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I3e1a7c1cd96b8c85cf0c20286533ced510580492

commit_message:
Fix SecurityGroupsOutputTest v3 security group tests

SecurityGroupsOutputTest was testing with security_group_api set to
neturon instead of nova. In addition, this patch fixes the tests to
match the v2 tests which tested more then the name matching 'fake'.

Fixes bug: 1229515

Change-Id: I5b1de35add3b8a131b9077c1c9396ae70d2faefa

subject: Fix several flake8 issues in the plugins/xenserver code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-24 15:36:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3ab3b2b3a5bdfd7f6e0fd933734debc018a175ec', 'message': 'Fix several flake8 issues in the plugins/xenserver code

Due to some issues in the gate, several flake8 errors got merged
recently. This patch fixes the most recent issues found.

Note that in cleaning up some of the H304 failures for relative imports,
I also re-arranged the imports to follow the hacking guide of doing
standard library packages first, then third party packages, and finally
nova-specific packages.

Closes-Bug: #1229753

Change-Id: I1c2211fd6a10d43d7e65cdb4e18530397788cf2c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-24 16:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/xenstore.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/pluginlib_nova.py', 'plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/utils.py', 'plugins/xenserver/networking/etc/xensource/scripts/vif_rules.py', 'plugins/xenserver/networking/etc/xensource/scripts/ovs_configure_vif_flows.py', 'plugins/xenserver/networking/etc/xensource/scripts/ovs_configure_base_flows.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/016e39734e1b70c1b004f1ae366c22b091463932', 'message': "Fix several flake8 issues in the plugins/xenserver code

Due to some issues in the gate, several flake8 errors got merged
recently. This patch fixes the most recent issues found.

For the H304 relative import errors, we have to skip those because they
are put into /etc/xensource/scripts which is the current working
directory when running the plugin.

For the H231 incompatible python 3 'except x,y' construct, we have to
skip those because this code is written to run on python 2.4 and 'except
x as y' does not work with python 2.4.

Note that in cleaning up some of the H304 failures for relative imports,
I also re-arranged the imports to follow the hacking guide of doing
standard library packages first, then third party packages, and finally
nova-specific packages.

Closes-Bug: #1229753

Change-Id: I1c2211fd6a10d43d7e65cdb4e18530397788cf2c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix several flake8 issues in the plugins/xenserver code

Due to some issues in the gate, several flake8 errors got merged
recently. This patch fixes the most recent issues found.

For the H304 relative import errors, we have to skip those because they
are put into /etc/xensource/scripts which is the current working
directory when running the plugin.

For the H231 incompatible python 3 'except x,y' construct, we have to
skip those because this code is written to run on python 2.4 and 'except
x as y' does not work with python 2.4.

Note that in cleaning up some of the H304 failures for relative imports,
I also re-arranged the imports to follow the hacking guide of doing
standard library packages first, then third party packages, and finally
nova-specific packages.

Closes-Bug: #1229753

Change-Id: I1c2211fd6a10d43d7e65cdb4e18530397788cf2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/86/48086/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Bring up interface when enslaving to a bridge

Right now, if the interface to be used for a nova-network bridge is
not already up, nova-network will enslave it and leave it down,
which is not very helpful. Since an interface for this purpose is
likely to be left unconfigured by the base OS, expecting it to be
up is not ideal.

Change-Id: I14564c0bcb55b9dd427ccaa8fb217e38121d4b71
Closes-bug: 1228183

commit_message:
Format error on urlfetch.get fail

The error messages for fetch failures of nested stacks have too much
detail. This change formats fetch fail errors in the same way
that TemplateResource does.

Change-Id: Ib8afa281a53f895086ce8890c828fe4a8bb469ae
Closes-Bug: #1214227

commit_message:
Fix volume_rpcapi calls for chance/simple scheds

Change the chance and simple schedulers to pass the snapshot_id and
image_id parameters correctly volume_rpcapi, so that their values reach
cinder-volume.

Change-Id: I0abbca1fa0445c5233387a0f17363fc092d39b88
Closes-Bug: #1212710
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/96/47896/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
